questions.question_text:
You are administering a database that supports a data warehousing workload and is running in noarchivelog mode. You use RMAN to perform a level 0 backup on
Sundays and level 1 incremental backups on all the other days of the week.
One of the data files is corrupted and the current online redo log file is lost because of a media failure.
Which action must you take for recovery?

choices.B: Restore the control file and all the data files, recover them by using the recover database noredo command, and use the resetlogs option to open the database.
choices.C: Restore all the data files, recover them by using the recover database command, and open the database.
choices.A: Restore the data file, recover it by using the recover datafilenoredo command, and use the resetlogs option to open the database.
choices.D: Restore all the data files, recover them by using the recover database noredo command, and use the resetlogs option to open the database.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about Oracle Restart?

choices.E: It runs periodic check operations to monitor the health of Oracle components.
choices.B: While starting any components, it automatically attempts to start all dependencies first and in proper order.
choices.A: It can be configured to automatically attempt to restart various components after a hardware or software failure.
choices.D: It can be used to only start Oracle components.
choices.C: It can be configured to automatically restart a database in case of normal shutdown of the database instance.

discussion.content:
The answer is A, B, E.
"When you install Oracle Restart, various Oracle components can be automatically restarted after a hardware or software failure or whenever your database host computer restarts"
REF: https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18283_01/server.112/e17120/restart001.htm

BDE oracle restart just oracle component 
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E18283_01/server.112/e17120/restart001.htm
Ill go for B, D, E.
ABE CORRECT
b,d,e correct?

I think answer ADE. I think answer C is not correct as the monitoring is used to determine any misestimates. After the first execution of the statement, monitoring is turned off. 
Doc: https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/TGSQL/tgsql_optcncpt.htm#TGSQL94983

questions.question_text:
Examine the parameters for your database instance:

NAMETYPEVALUE -
------------------------------------------------
optimizer_adaptive_reporting_onlybooleanFALSE
optimizer_capture_sql_plan_baselinesbooleanFALSE
optimizer_dynamic_samplinginteger2
optimizer_features_enablestring12.1.0.1
Which three statements are true about the process of automatic optimization by using statistics feedback?
questions.answer_description:
C: During the first execution of a SQL statement, an execution plan is generated as usual.
D: if multi-column statistics are not present for the relevant combination of columns, the optimizer can fall back on cardinality feedback.
(not B)* Cardinality feedback. This feature, enabled by default in 11.2, is intended to improve plans for repeated executions. optimizer_dynamic_sampling optimizer_features_enable
Dynamic sampling or multi-column statistics allow the optimizer to more accurately estimate selectivity of conjunctive predicates.
Note:
* OPTIMIZER_DYNAMIC_SAMPLING controls the level of dynamic sampling performed by the optimizer.

Range of values. 0 to 10 -
Cardinality feedback was introduced in Oracle Database 11gR2. The purpose of this feature is to automatically improve plans for queries that are executed repeatedly, for which the optimizer does not estimate cardinalities in the plan properly. The optimizer may misestimate cardinalities for a variety of reasons, such as missing or inaccurate statistics, or complex predicates. Whatever the reason for the misestimate, cardinality feedback may be able to help.

choices.A: The optimizer automatically changes a plan during subsequent execution of a SQL statement if there is a huge difference in optimizer estimates and execution statistics.
choices.C: The optimizer enables monitoring for cardinality feedback after the first execution of a query.
choices.B: The optimizer can re optimize a query only once using cardinality feedback.
choices.D: The optimizer does not monitor cardinality feedback if dynamic sampling and multicolumn statistics are enabled.
choices.E: After the optimizer identifies a query as a re-optimization candidate, statistics collected by the collectors are submitted to the optimizer.

discussion.content:
After research, I think the answer is A, F.
This question is asking about Active Database Duplication with RMAN, and according to the reference, what Simon22 is saying is right.
Also in my opinion, option B is quite confusing. NOFILENAMECHECK does duplicate the filenames, but structure? I don't think so. 
REF: https://oracle-base.com/articles/11g/duplicate-database-using-rman-11gr2#active_database_duplication

comments.content:
After studying more, B, F.
Sorry for the confusion T_T

discussion.content: E is not correct because you can use pfile intead of spfile. BF must be correct.
Answer is BF

A: f this is an active duplicate, all necessary logs should be shipped automatically from the target to the auxiliary instance. 
F: Oracle 11g introduced the ability to create duplicate databases directly without the need for a backup. This is known as active database duplication.

comments.content:
About Active Database Duplication with RMAN
In active database duplication, RMAN connects as TARGET to the source database instance and as AUXILIARY to the auxiliary instance. RMAN then manages the copying of the database to the auxiliary instance over the network. No backups of the source database are required.

discussion.content: I think answer A,B,C/D,. F is not correct because backup(sets) are being automatically generated during execution of the duplicate command. Doc: https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/BRADV/rcmdupdb.htm#BRADV89931.
BF is correct
my answer here is B E
B E in my opinion
Answer BF
Correct Ans: BF
The correct answer is BE, NOFILENAMECHECK has the same dir

questions.question_text:
RMAN is connected to the target database prod1 and an auxiliary instance in nomount state. Examine the command to create a duplicate database:
RMAN> DUPLICATE TARGET DATABASE TO dup1

FROM ACTIVE DATABASE -

NOFILENAMECHECK -

PASSWORD FILE -
SPFILE;
Which two statements are true about the execution of the duplicate command?

choices.F: The duplicate database is created without using RMAN backups and prod: is allowed to remain open during duplication.
choices.A: All archive redo log files are automatically copied to the duplicate database.
choices.C: The duplicate database is created by using the backups created during the execution of
choices.E: The password file and SPFILE for the duplicate database dup1 are created in their respective default locations.
choices.B: The duplicate database has the same directory structure as the source database.

choices.E: Create a new temporary tablespace and assign it as the default to the user.
choices.D: Take the temporary tablespace offline, recover the missing temp file, and then bring the temporary tablespace online.
choices.B: Add a new temp file to the temporary tablespace and drop the tempOi.dbf file.
choices.A: Drop the tenpOi.dbf file, and then re-create the temp file.
choices.C: Shut down the database instance, start up the database instance in mount state, create a new temporary tablespace, and then open the database.

questions.question_text:
A user issues a query on the sales table and receives the following error:
ERROR at line 1:
ORA-01565: error in identifying file '/u0l/app/oracle/oradata/ORCL/temp01.dbf'
ORA-27037: unable to obtain file status
Which two actions would you take to recover the temporary tablespace?
